group.name: JPEG2000
group.description: Helioviewer.org and JHelioviewer operate off of JPEG2000 formatted image data generated from science-quality FITS files. Use the APIs below to interact directly with these intermediary JPEG2000 files.

group.name: Movies
group.description:
The movie APIs can be used to generate custom videos of up to three image datasource layers composited together. Solar feature/event markers pins, extended region polygons, associated text labels, and a size-of-earth scale indicator can optionally be overlayed onto a movie.

Movie generation is performed asynchronously due to the amount of resources required to complete each video. Movie requests are queued and then processed (in the order in which they are received) by one of several worker processes operating in parallel.

As a user of the API, begin by sending a 'queueMovie' request. If your request is successfully added to the queue, you will receive a response containing a unique movie identifier. This identifier can be used to monitor the status of your movie via 'getMovieStatus' and then download or play it (via 'downloadMovie' or 'playMovie') once its status marked as completed.

Movies may contain between 10 and 300 frames. The movie frames are chosen by matching the closest image available at each step within the specified range of dates, and are automatically selected by the API. The region to be included in the movie may be specified using either the top-left and bottom-right coordinates in arc-seconds, or a center point in arc-seconds and a width and height in pixels. See the Coordinates Appendix for more infomration about working with the coordinates used by Helioviewer.org.

group.name: Screenshots
group.description: The screenshot APIs can be used to generate custom videos of up to three image datasource layers composited together. Solar feature/event markers pins, extended region polygons, associated text labels, and a size-of-earth scale indicator can optionally be overlayed onto a movie.

group.name: Solar Features and Events
group.description:
Helioviewer.org's solar features and events annotation layer is powered by the Heliophysics Events Knowledgebase (HEK) provided by the Lockheed Martin Solar & Astrophysics Laboratory (LMSAL).

Consult LMSAL's HEK API Documentation for more information.

endpoint.name: checkYouTubeAuth
endpoint.description: Check to see if Helioveiwer.org is authorized to interact with a user's YouTube account via the current browser session.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

endpoint.name: queueMovie
endpoint.description: Create a custom movie by submitting a request to the movie generation queue. The response returned will provide you with a unique Movie ID that can be used to check on the status of your movie (via `getMovieStatus`) and to download your movie (via `downloadMovie`).

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: Desired date and time of the first frame of the movie. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: endTime
parameter.description: Desired date and time of the final frame of the movie. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: layers
parameter.description: Image datasource layer(s) to include in the movie.

parameter.name: events
parameter.description: List feature/event types and FRMs to use to annoate the movie. Use the empty string to indicate that no feature/event annotations should be shown.

parameter.name: eventsLabels
parameter.description: Optionally annotate each event marker with a text label.

parameter.name: imageScale
parameter.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: Movie format (`mp4`, `webm`, `flv`). Default value is `mp4`.

parameter.name: frameRate
parameter.description: Movie frames per second. 15 frames per second by default.

parameter.name: maxFrames
parameter.description: Maximum number of frames in the movie. May be capped by the server.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: Optionally overlay an image scale indicator.

parameter.name: scaleType
parameter.description: Image scale indicator.

parameter.name: scaleX
parameter.description: Horizontal offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

parameter.name: scaleY
parameter.description: Vertical offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

parameter.name: movieLength
parameter.description: Movie length in seconds.

parameter.name: watermark
parameter.description: Optionally overlay a Helioviewer.org watermark image. Enabled by default.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: Width of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `height`).

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: Height of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `width`).

parameter.name: x0
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun. Used in conjunction with `y0`, `width`, and `height`.

parameter.name: y0
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun. Used in conjunction with `x0`, `width`, and `height`.

parameter.name: x1
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `y1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: y1
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: x2
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: y2
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `x2`.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description:
Scale video to preset size:
0 - Original size;
1 - 720p (1280 x 720, HD Ready);
2 - 1080p (1920 x 1080, Full HD);
3 - 1440p (2560 x 1440, Quad HD);
4 - 2160p (3840 x 2160, 4K or Ultra HD).

parameter.name: movieIcons
parameter.description: Display other user generated movies on the video.

parameter.name: followViewport
parameter.description: Rotate field of view of movie with Sun.

parameter.name: reqObservationDate
parameter.description: Viewport time. Used when 'followViewport' enabled to shift viewport area to correct coordinates.

response.description: JSON response to "queueMovie" and "reQueueMovie" API requests.

endpoint.name: reQueueMovie
endpoint.description: Re-generate a custom movie that is no longer cached on disk. Once the movie has been successfully queued for regeneration, the Movie ID can be used to check on the status of the movie (via `getMovieStatus`) and to download the movie (via `downloadMovie`).

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

response.description: JSON response to "queueMovie" and "reQueueMovie" API requests.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: Movie format (`mp4`, `webm`, or `flv`).

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Optionally include extra metadata in the response.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

response.description: A JSON object containing metadata describing a user-generated movie, including its generation status (0=queued, 1=processing, 2=finished, 3=invalid).
A JSON object containing metadata describing a user-generated movie, including its generation status (0=queued, 1=processing, 2=finished, 3=invalid) and the parameters used to create it.

endpoint.name: downloadMovie
endpoint.description: Download a custom movie in one of three file formats.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: Movie Format (`mp4`, `webm`, or `flv`).

parameter.name: hq
parameter.description: Optionally download a higher-quality movie file (valid for .mp4 movies only, ignored otherwise).

endpoint.name: takeScreenshot
endpoint.description:
Generate a custom screenshot.
You must specify values for either `x1`, `y1`, `x2`, and `y2` or `x0`, `y0`, `width` and `height`.
By default, the response is a JSON object containing a unique screenshot identifier (`id`) that can be used to with the `downloadScreenshot` API endpoint.
Set the `display` parameter to `true` to directly return the screenshot as binary PNG image data in the response.
Please note that each request causes the server to generate a screenshot from scratch and is resource intensive. For performance reasons, you should cache the response if you simply intend to serve exactly the same screenshot to multiple users.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: Desired date/time of the image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: imageScale
parameter.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

parameter.name: layers
parameter.description: Image datasource layer(s) to include in the screenshot.

parameter.name: events
parameter.description: List feature/event types and FRMs to use to annoate the movie. Use the empty string to indicate that no feature/event annotations should be shown.

parameter.name: eventLabels
parameter.description: Optionally annotate each event marker with a text label.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: Optionally overlay an image scale indicator.

parameter.name: scaleType
parameter.description: Image scale indicator.

parameter.name: scaleX
parameter.description: Horizontal offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

parameter.name: scaleY
parameter.description: Vertical offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: Width of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `height`).

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: Height of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `width`).

parameter.name: x0
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun. Used in conjunction with `y0`, `width`, and `height`.

parameter.name: y0
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun. Used in conjunction with `x0`, `width`, and `height`.

parameter.name: x1
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `y1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: y1
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: x2
parameter.description: The horizontal offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `y2`.

parameter.name: y2
parameter.description: The vertical offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `x2`.

parameter.name: display
parameter.description: Set to `true` to directly output binary PNG image data. Default is `false` (which outputs a JSON object).

parameter.name: watermark
parameter.description: Optionally overlay a watermark consisting of a Helioviewer logo and the datasource abbreviation(s) and timestamp(s) displayed in the screenshot.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

response.description: JSON response to "takeScreenshot" API requests. Assumes that the `display` parameter was omitted or set to `false`.
Set the `display` parameter to `true` to directly return binary PNG image data in the response.

endpoint.name: downloadScreenshot
endpoint.description: Download a custom screenshot (that was generated using the `takeScreenshot` API endpoint).

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique screenshot identifier (provided by the response to a `takeScreenshot` request).

endpoint.name: getClosestImage
endpoint.description: Find the image data that is closest to the requested date/time. Return the associated metadata from the helioviewer database and the XML header of the JPEG2000 image file.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: Desired date/time of the image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: Unique image datasource identifier.

response.description: A JSON object containing metadata related to the JPEG2000 image representing the closest temporal match for the specified datasource.

endpoint.name: getDataSources
endpoint.description:
Return a hierarchial list of the available datasources.
Optional parameter `verbose` is exists for compatability with JHelioviewer. It outputs the hierarchical list in an alternative format and limits the list of available datasources to a known set (SDO and SOHO). JHelioviewer may not operate properly if new datasources appear in the feed without a client-side updgrade. To explicitly include new sources, use the optional `enable` parameter.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Comma-separated list of observatories to enable.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

response.description: Output the hierarchical list of available datasources in a format that is compatible with the JHelioviewer desktop client.

endpoint.name: getJP2Image
endpoint.description: Download a JP2 image for the specified datasource that is the closest match in time to the `date` requested.

parameter.name: date
parameter.description: Desired date/time of the JP2 image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: Unique image datasource identifier.

parameter.name: jpip
parameter.description: Optionally return a JPIP URI instead of the binary data of the image itself.

parameter.name: json
parameter.description: Optionally return a JSON object.

response.description: By default, JPEG2000 binary image data is returned. This assumes that the `jpip` parameter is omitted or set to `false`.
If request parameter `jpip` is set to `true` (and the `json` parameter is omitted or set to `false`) the reponse is a plain text string.
If request parameters `jpip` and `json` are both set to `true`, the reponse is a JSON object.

endpoint.name: getJP2Header
endpoint.description: Get the XML header embedded in a JPEG2000 image. Includes the FITS header as well as a section of Helioviewer-specific metadata.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique JP2 image identifier.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

endpoint.name: getJPX
endpoint.description: Generate and (optionally) download a custom JPX movie of the specified datasource.

parameter.name: startTime
parameter.description: Date/Time for the beginning of the JPX movie data. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: endTime
parameter.description: Date/Time for the end of the JPX movie data. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: Unique image datasource identifier.

parameter.name: linked
parameter.description: Generate a `linked` JPX file containing image pointers instead of data for each individual frame in the series. Currently, only JPX image series support this feature.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If set to `true,` the JSON response will include timestamps for each frame in the resulting movie and any warning messages associated with the request, in addition to the JPX movie file URI.

parameter.name: jpip
parameter.description: Optionally return a JPIP URI string instead of the binary data of the movie itself, or instead of an HTTP URI in the JSON response (if `verbose` is set to `true`).

parameter.name: cadence
parameter.description:
The desired amount of time (in seconds) between each frame in the movie.
If no cadence is specified, the server will attempt to select an optimal cadence.

response.description: By default, JPX binary movie data is returned. This assumes that the `jpip` and `verbose` parameters are omitted or set to `false`.
If the `jpip` parameter is set to `true` (and the `verbose` parameter is omitted or set to `false`) the reponse is a a JPIP-protocol link to the JPX movie as a plain text string.

If request parameters `jpip` and `verbose` are both set to `true`, the reponse is a JSON object containing a JPIP-protocol link to the JPX movie plus the timestamps of each frame a message if the value of `cadence` was overridden by the server.

If request parameters `verbose` is set to `true` and `jpip` is omitted or set to `false`, the reponse is a JSON object containing an HTTP-protocol link to the JPX movie plus the timestamps of each frame a message if the value of `cadence` was overridden by the server.
response.example: { "message": "Movie cadence has been changed to one image every 1284 seconds in order to avoid exceeding the maximum allowed number of frames (1000) between the requested start and end dates.", "uri": "http://api.helioviewer.org/jp2/movies/SOHO_MDI_MDI_magnetogram_F2003-10-05T00.00.00Z_T2003-10-20T00.00.00ZB1L.jpx", "frames": [ 1065323703, 1065329463, 1065335223, [...], 1066596483, 1066602183, 1066607943 ] }

endpoint.name: getJPXClosestToMidPoint
endpoint.description: Generate and (optionally) download a custom JPX movie of the specified datasource with one frame per pair of startTimes/endTimes parameters.

parameter.name: startTimes
parameter.description: Comma separated Date/Time timestamps for the beginning of the JPX movie data. Date and time in Unix timestamps format separated with commas.

parameter.name: endTimes
parameter.description: Comma separated Date/Time timestamps for the end of the JPX movie data. Date and time in Unix timestamps format separated with commas.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.description: Unique image datasource identifier.

parameter.name: linked
parameter.description: Generate a `linked` JPX file containing image pointers instead of data for each individual frame in the series. Currently, only JPX image series support this feature.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If set to `true,` the JSON response will include timestamps for each frame in the resulting movie and any warning messages associated with the request, in addition to the JPX movie file URI.

parameter.name: jpip
parameter.description: Optionally return a JPIP URI string instead of the binary data of the movie itself, or instead of an HTTP URI in the JSON response (if `verbose` is set to `true`).

response.description: By default, JPX binary movie data is returned. This assumes that the `jpip` and `verbose` parameters are omitted or set to `false`.
If the `jpip` parameter is set to `true` (and the `verbose` parameter is omitted or set to `false`) the reponse is a a JPIP-protocol link to the JPX movie as a plain text string.

If request parameters `jpip` and `verbose` are both set to `true`, the reponse is a JSON object containing a JPIP-protocol link to the JPX movie plus the timestamps of each frame a message if the value of `cadence` was overridden by the server.

If request parameters `verbose` is set to `true` and `jpip` is omitted or set to `false`, the reponse is a JSON object containing an HTTP-protocol link to the JPX movie plus the timestamps of each frame a message if the value of `cadence` was overridden by the server.

endpoint.name: getStatus
endpoint.description: Returns information about how far behind the latest available JPEG2000 images.

response.description: JSON response to "getStatus"

endpoint.name: getNewsFeed
endpoint.description: Get the XML RSS feed of the official Helioviewer Project Blog.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

endpoint.name: getTile
endpoint.description:
Request a single image tile to be used in the Helioviewer.org Viewport. Tiles are 512x512 pixel PNG images, generated for a given image scale from the intermediary JPEG2000 image files.
Use the `getClosestImage` API endpoint to obtain the desired image identifier for the `id` parameter.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique image identifier.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: Tile position.

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: Tile position.

parameter.name: imageScale
parameter.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

parameter.name: difference
parameter.description:
Specify image type difference.
0 - Display regular image;
0 - Running difference image;
0 - Base difference image.

parameter.name: diffCount
parameter.description: Used to display Running difference image. Work with "diffTime" parameter and set amount of time to use in tyme period

parameter.name: diffTime
parameter.description:
Select Running difference time period:
0 - Seconds;
1 - Minutes;
2 - Hours;
3 - Days;
4 - Weeks;
5 - Month;
6 - Years.

parameter.name: baseDiffTime
parameter.description: Date/Time string for Base difference images.

endpoint.name: getYouTubeAuth
endpoint.description: Request authorization from the user via a Google / YouTube authorization flow to permit Helioviewer to upload videos on behalf of the user.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

parameter.name: title
parameter.description: Movie title.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Move description.
parameter.example: This movie was produced by Helioviewer.org. See the original at http://helioviewer.org/?movieId=z6vX5 or download a high-quality version from http://api.helioviewer.org/v2/downloadMovie/?id=z6vX5&format=mp4&hq=true

parameter.name: tags
parameter.description: Movie keyword tags (comma separated).

parameter.name: share
parameter.description: Optionally share the movie with the Helioviewer community.

response.description: Redirect user to YouTube authorization page.

endpoint.name: playMovie
endpoint.description: Output an HTML web page with the requested movie embedded within.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: Movie format (mp4, webm, or flv).

parameter.name: hq
parameter.description: Optionally download a higher-quality movie file (valid for .mp4 movies only, ignored otherwise).

parameter.name: width
parameter.description: Width of embedded movie player in pixels. Defaults to the actual width of the movie itself.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: Height of embedded movie player in pixels. Defaults to the actual height of the movie itself.

endpoint.name: shortenURL
endpoint.description: Shorten a Helioviewer.org URL with the bit.ly URL shortening web service.

parameter.name: queryString
parameter.description: URL-encoded query string.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

endpoint.name: uploadMovieToYouTube
endpoint.description: Share an existing user-generated movie to YouTube.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

parameter.name: title
parameter.description: Movie title.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Move description.
parameter.example: This movie was produced by Helioviewer.org. See the original at http://helioviewer.org/?movieId=y9tX5 or download a high-quality version from http://api.helioviewer.org/downloadMovie/?id=y9tX5&format=mp4&hq=true

parameter.name: tags
parameter.description: Movie keyword tags (comma separated).

parameter.name: share
parameter.description: Optionally share the movie with the Helioviewer community.

parameter.name: html
parameter.description: Optionally output response as HTML instead of JSON.

response.description: JSON response to "uploadMovieToYouTube" API requests.

error.description: "Error encountered during authentication. Revoke access for Helioviewer.org in your Google settings page and try again."
"Movie has already been uploaded. Please allow several minutes for your video to appear on YouTube."

endpoint.name: getUserVideos
endpoint.description: Get a listing (in descending time order) of the most recently user-generated movies that have been publicly shared to YouTube. Result set is limited to the value requested or default value of the `num` parameter (unless truncated when the date value of the `since` parameter is reached).

parameter.name: num
parameter.description: Number of shared user-generated movies to include in the response. Default is 10.

parameter.name: since
parameter.description: Optionally truncate result set if this date/time is reached. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: force
parameter.description: Optionally bypass cache to retrieve most up-to-date data.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

endpoint.name: getSciDataScript
endpoint.description: Returns a python script that will download FITS data in the given parameters.

parameter.name: imageScale
parameter.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

parameter.name: sourceIds
parameter.description: Array of instrument source IDs.

parameter.name: startDate
parameter.description: Desired start date and time of the download range. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: endDate
parameter.description: Desired end date and time of the download range. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

parameter.name: lang
parameter.description: 'sunpy' or 'sswidl' Desired python library to use.

response.description: Retrieve fits data from 2021-12-27 00:00:00 to 2021-12-28 00:00:00 for AIA 304

model.name: Error
model.description: A JSON object containing a numerical error code and a textual error message.

simple.name: endDate
simple.description: Date of final frame in movie (e.g. "2014-02-05 19:40:16")

simple.name: startDate
simple.description: Date of first frame in movie (e.g. "2014-02-05 19:40:16")

simple.name: url
simple.description: Download URL for movie in specified format

simple.name: events
simple.description: Solar Feature/Event layer(s) contained in movie

simple.name: imageScale
simple.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel (e.g. 2.42044)

simple.name: layers
simple.description: Image datasource layer(s) contained in movie

simple.name: icon
simple.description: URL to icon-sized thumbnail PNG (64x64 pixels)

simple.name: large
simple.description: URL to large thumbnail PNG (640x480 pixels)

simple.name: medium
simple.description: URL to medium thumbnail PNG (320x240 pixels)

simple.name: small
simple.description: URL to small thumbnail PNG (240x180 pixels)

simple.name: eta
simple.description: Estimated time until movie generation will be completed in seconds

simple.name: uri
simple.description: JPIP protocol link to JP2 image.

simple.name: message
simple.description: Message describing any values overrided by the server.

simple.name: uri
simple.description: JPIP protocol link to the JPX movie.

simple.name: message
simple.description: An informational message may be included (e.g. if the server overrode the `cadence` parameter).

simple.name: uri
simple.description: JPIP protocol link to the JPX movie.

simple.name: scale
simple.description: Image scale in arc-seconds per pixel.

simple.name: width
simple.description: Width in pixels of source JPEG2000 image data.

simple.name: height
simple.description: Height in pixels of source JPEG2000 image data.

simple.name: layeringOrder
simple.description: Relative order for image layer compositing.

model.name: Get Data Sources Verbose
model.description: Output the hierarchical list of available datasources in a format that is compatible with the JHelioviewer desktop client.
